channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump doubles down on damage U.S. strikes caused to Iran's nuclear sites
item.description: President Trump spoke at the conclusion of the summit in the Netherlands — as the world watches to see whether a ceasefire between Israel and Iran wil...

item.title: Israel was once deterred from striking Iran. Now Netanyahu takes a victory lap
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu wanted to attack Iran for decades, but the U.S. and his own security chiefs deterred him. Now he's basking i...

item.title: RFK Jr.'s picks for CDC vaccine advisers meet this week amid controversy
item.description: For the first time since Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. replaced all the members of the vaccine committee, it is meeting in Atlanta.

item.title: Iran's nuclear program set back 'a few months.' And, Trump to meet with NATO allies
item.description: An early assessment by the Defense Intelligence Agency believes the damage to Iran's most important nuclear site was limited. And, Trump will meet wit...

item.title: Greetings from Odesa, Ukraine, where a Black Sea beach offers respite from war
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares snapshots of moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Watch: BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from Iran on the ceasefire with Israel
item.description: Lyse Doucet reports from the streets of Tehran, where she says things are staring to return to normal.

item.title: Astronauts from India, Poland and Hungary blast off on a privately funded trip to the space station
Supreme Court lets Trump administration resume deportations to third countries
item.description: Thousands of migrants in the U.S. facing deportation could now find themselves being sent to a country an ocean away. Legal analysts Leah Litman and K...

item.title: Man executed for raping, killing Florida woman outside bar
item.description: Thomas Lee Gudinas became the seventh person executed in Florida this year, with an eighth execution scheduled for July.

item.title: Trump pushes back after leaked report suggests Iran strikes had limited impact
item.description: The US president says the strikes led to the "virtual obliteration" of Iran's nuclear capabilities while speaking at a Nato summit.

item.title: Trump says U.S. will meet with Iran next week
item.description: President Trump spoke to reporters at the NATO summit in the Netherlands amid the tenuous Iran-Israel ceasefire.

item.title: Trump speaks at NATO summit, defends U.S. strikes on Iran
item.description: President Trump held a press conference at the NATO summit in The Hague, Netherlands, where he defended U.S. strikes on Iran's nuclear sites and addre...

item.title: Eurostar passengers face severe delays after cable theft
item.description: The rail operator says that repairs are now complete but lines are open, but delays will last until the end of the day.

item.title: Damaged or destroyed - how much does leaked US report on Iran's nuclear sites tell us?
item.description: Fordo is probably the most spied-on place on the planet - and work to understand what is happening there is set to intensify further.

item.title: 5 hidden costs of ignoring your IRS tax debt
item.description: Unpaid tax debt can quietly drain your finances and your peace of mind. Here are the hidden costs to watch for.

item.title: Nato agrees to ramp up defence spending and says collective security is 'ironclad'
item.description: The 32 leaders also said they were reaffirming their "ironclad commitment to collective defence".

item.title: In US, the Iranian diaspora contends with the Israel-Iran war and a fragile ceasefire

item.title: Zohran Mamdani declares victory in NYC’s Democratic mayoral primary as Cuomo concedes
